themes: Critique of prioritizing local fine artists over broader talent
Perceived inferiority of Austin's fine arts compared to other cities
Support for focusing on music and live performance as Austin's strength
Comparison to Houston's airport arts program and its broader artist representation
Concern about provincialism in cultural funding
key_phrases: highlighting Austin's fine artists over national/regional artists is provincial and backwards thinking
for music, I think it makes sense to focus on local artists
Austin's fine arts community... is substandard borderline amateurish compared to Houston, San Antonio and Dallas
The City had an airport arts program in partnership with local museums/fine arts organizations
the art was EXCELLENT and a world class representation
Austin's fine arts can't match the competition. And that's ok. Focus on our strengths - music and live music performance
barriers_identified: Provincial focus on local fine artists limits quality and diversity
solutions_proposed: Focus on music and live music performance as Austin's cultural strength
Broaden representation in fine arts to include national and international artists
